bio: I'm French, live in LA & NY, I draw, I write, I'm the founder of atelierdore.com & NY Times Best Selling author of #LoveStyleLife | @atelierdore 💋

list.comment: On the steps on our way to the beach with my forever shoes and my new maillot... #garanceinitaly

I just spent the most beautiful Thanksgiving break, alone in Maui (yes - totally untraditional but absolutely needed) with that view on the moon and the ocean everyday. A full moon on the ocean - does it get any more sublime?
.
What a way to pause and be thankful for all the lessons I have learned this year and all the wonderful people that make my life.
.
Specifically on this one, thank you Tom and Anthony @mistersperduti @partnersandspade - and thank you to all the people who sent me the best recommendations about the island as well as to @alohanif who a few years ago showed me the way to Hawaii’s heart.
.
Today I am on my way to Chile, to the Atacama Desert for our retreat on self discovery with @atelierdore - there again we will be so close to the stars and the moon - but this time it will be supported by each other in communion. .
I can’t wait to share more with you.

Trying new things!! I’ve heard about K Beauty forever, so I was excited when @saks sent me these. The textures are super different, they moisturize, smooth, hydrate and firm (perfect for winter even if you live in LA...) Can’t wait to try more! #saksbeauty

I love Instagram because I love pretty images but I also hate Instagram because of pretty images. Because « pretty » can become a prison.
.
A bright, colorful, smiling photo will almost always get more likes than a dark, imperfect, real photo. .
For any creator it is a curse. Imagine any artist creating with “likes” in mind? How many major works of art would have been turned into “pretty” instead of challenging, deep, thought-provoking?
.
How many messages would have been transformed into just a punchline?
.
I have always been afraid of numbers. Statistics and numbers. Gah! They’re the enemy of my creativity. They often kill it.
.
When “likes” appeared, I don’t think anybody knew what tyranny they would become. Because we’re all human. We’re made of emotions. I don’t know one person who can honestly say she doesn’t get a boost the more likes she gets.
.
I wish Instagram would come up with a way to opt out of numbers. To have a version of it as an option that wouldn’t show you the number of followers of one person, the numbers of likes and not count the number of comments.
.
You would be able to chose what option you prefer. If you like counting your likes, go at it.
.
But if you’re like me and don’t like having numbers thrown at your face all day long, good or bad - you would just switch numbers off and Instagram could become what I see in it, a fascinating platform for self expression.
.
This system would have traps too - but at least it would be a start?
.
I know Instagram implemented changes in terms of controlling the time we spend on it - but I honestly don’t believe in this at all.
.
It’s, again, putting all the responsibility and guilt on the user, treating us as addicts... Which we probably are.
.
I believe in making people’s emotional lives easier, not more complicated. I believe we can create tools that bring us more freedom. And I really believe it’s time to take mental health seriously.
.
I would love to hear your thoughts on this!
#gdmentalhealthjourney

Do you think we can have friendship “coup de foudre”? I think so.
.
I met @ellenmariebennett about two weeks ago at a dinner. We were both wearing @vans once we figured that out that basically was it. We jumped on each other and started talking and laughing like we had known eachother forever.
.
She also told me she was getting married a few days later, and showed me her dress, and I said be careful I might crash that wedding! To which she said : you should!!!
.
We laughed about it and that was it.
.
Then a few days later I went to visit her in her amazing factory (yes she has a factory) with @em_note and we were still joking about the wedding when, just like that, she popped an invite and was like “Come!!!”
.
I looked at Emily and she said “GO! You should go!”
.
I knew @clarevivier was going to be at the wedding and I was about to go have coffee with her.
.
So I told Ellen “You’re crazy. I am seeing Clare right after this. I am gonna tell her about all this. She’s a reasonable woman. She’ll tell me you’re crazy. If she doesn’t, I promise I’ll come.”
.
The second I talked to Clare she was like “Oh, come, you can stay with us!!!” I didn’t even know who “us” was, but I was like okay now. This is it I am going.
.
This is the story of how I ended up in Mexico at the wedding of a new best friend I had just met two weeks ago, with one lady I thought was reasonable but is actually way more fun than me and another woman I didn’t know but said “Yay I’ll share my bed with a total stranger” (Clare and Jen ended up sharing the bed and I spread myself leisurely on the other one) - and who I completely fell in love with, @jengotch .
.
And all that just says how special and crazy and fabulous @ellenmariebennett is and how happy I am for her and @caseycaplowe and all the fabulous people around them.
.
Check out my stories highlights if you want to see more of that fabulous, fabulous weekend and how much I loved my sexy roommates. #ebxcc
The beautiful street & signs of Mexico City. I can’t wait to go back! #garanceinmexico

Love!!! This woman @ellenmariebennett is absolutely amazing (I can’t wait to tell you how I met her) and so is her company @hedleyandbennett AND so was the delicious @bonappetitmag and @samsungus Chef Collection dinner she hosted yesterday - it’s too much to take in!!!!

This season I went to two very different and very magical weddings. The first one was the intimate and heart warming one of one of my closest friend (or more like, sister), @em_note in Italy, and the second one was the giant and incredible feast of a very new and incredibly dear friend, @ellenmariebennett (more photos to come)
.
Each time I sneaked in a few moments before the ceremony to give a hug. And each time I was taken by the palpable and incredible emotion. And by the joy that I felt for the bride in that suspended moment in time.
.
PS : It’s my speech I have in my hand. I took it really seriously and came with giant papers in hand. I was told there is nothing worse than reading from a phone. Very true - next time I’ll take it to the next level and have actual cards. So chic.
.
PPS : Oh also, isn’t that dress awesome!?? It’s from @ladoublej and it felt soooo perfect for a Tuscan wedding...
.
PPPS : I can’t vote in America because I am French, so please go vote for me. It is so so so important!!!

Travelling is magic to me (and meeting new people, cultures, learning new languages...) and I had always wanted it to be a big part of my life.
.
Only thing is, I miss Lulu! Right now she’s with her dog sitter and it’s okay but I want to take her on more of my trips. She’s totally cool on a plane, sleeps in her bag, doesn’t make a noise and people don’t even notice her.
.
Do you guys have any tips for traveling to different countries with a small dog?
.
PS - a lot of people who see her are surprised by how small she is, apparently she looks bigger in photos but she’s just 21 pounds :).
.
PPS : this her rolled up in one of my fuzzy pillows. She loves to be super warm 😌 #muttsofinstagram

Hello from Laguna!
I discovered @hoteljoaquin on a yoga retreat with @livetheprocess a few weeks ago and I am already back there eating their amazing coconut yogurt. Perfect spot for a little weekend out of town... Photo by the best @magdawosinskastudio
